uas.lntv.pacmangame.Screens

Class ScoreScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • uas.lntv.pacmangame.Screens.MapScreen
      • uas.lntv.pacmangame.Screens.ScoreScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class ScoreScreen
extends MapScreen
    The ScoreScreen is an extension of the MapScreen class, and it's there to present the current high-scores that are stored on your device. It will pop up, if you are ending a game with a new high-score, or if you chose the right field in the settings. The only thing you can do here is quit the Screen and return back to the MenuScreen.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        This method draws and animates PacMan on the high-score board and writes the scores with the associated names on the screen. It also detects, if PacMan moved over the threshold, that makes you return to the MenuScreen.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Overrides:
        render in class MapScreen
        Parameters:
        delta - time value
        See Also:
        MapScreen

      • update

        public void update(float dt)
        Checks the position of PacMan for quitting this screen or resetting all settings.
        Overrides:
        update in class MapScreen
        Parameters:
        dt - time parameter used by libGDX
